III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth were fighting at the encouragement of staff. Youth A
reported that he was sexually abused while placed at the facility
and staff did not respond appropriately.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 10/10/2023 and no additional
information was provided. In the original allegations it was
described that Youth A informed the complainant that during his
time at the facility Staff 1 would make youth fight each other. He
did not have a first name for Staff 1. He witnessed this on two
occasions and heard about it on 3 or 4 other occasions. Youth A
also reported to the complainant that he was sexually assaulted
by other youth in the program while placed there. No other details
were provided other than this was perpetrated by a group of
individuals on Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed by a child advocacy center on
11/21/2023. This was viewed over video with DHHS Worker 1
and law enforcement was present at the interview. At the
beginning of the interview Youth A requested that law
enforcement be in the room with him, and then proceeded to state
that he had nothing to say about the allegations in question.
Youth A only further stated that he was not going to talk about his
time placed at the facility and the interview then ended.
Chief Administrator was interviewed over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1 on 11/29/2023. Chief Administrator stated that he spoke
with the previous administrator of the facility and neither of them
were able to recall any situations where there was concern of fight
club type behavior among youth or sexual assault allegations
similar to those presented in these current allegations. The Chief
Administrator stated that he could recall Youth A being placed at
the facility but never was aware of any sexual assault allegations
made by or about Youth A. He also stated that he was never
aware of any situations that involved Youth A being in a fight with
multiple other youth outside of staff supervising and intervening.
Chief Administrator provided contact information for a Staff 1 that
2

used to be employed at the facility as he was the only other staff
member that would have had the last name of who was mentioned
as a possibility of who could have been involved in the allegations.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 11/29/2023. Supervisor 1 stated he has worked at the facility
since prior to Youth A’s placement and Staff 1’s employment.
Supervisor 1 stated that he had never heard of or had concern
about possible fighting among youth that was not intervened upon
by supervising staff. Supervisor 1 also stated that he had never
been presented with any concerns related to a sexual assault
perpetrated by a group of youth.
Therapist 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1
on 11/29/2023. He stated that he was assigned to work with
Youth A during his time placed at the program. Therapist 1
believed that he had contact with Youth A almost every day
through their regularly scheduled sessions, as well as through
random contact on campus. Therapist 1 stated that he never had
any concerns that there was organized fighting occurring between
youth, nor that there were any sexual assault concerns related to
Youth A. Therapist 1 also added that he had contact with Youth A
and Youth A’s family after the placement ended for aftercare
services, and there was nothing of concern that came up at that
time either.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/29/2023. He could not recall Youth A being placed at the
program. Staff 1 stated that he never encountered concerns
about organized fighting among youth, staff being aware of
fighting and not acting appropriately or any concerns of sexual
assault being perpetrated between youth at the program.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were interviewed separately over video
conference on 12/12/2023. Both staff recalled working with Youth
A during his placement and Staff 1 during his employment with the
program. Neither staff were aware of any concerns about
organized fighting or sexual assault within the program.
Youth B, Youth C and Youth D were interviewed separately over
video conference on 12/12/2023. None of the youth were familiar
with Youth A or Staff 1 because there are no youth currently
placed that overlapped time at the program with either individual.
All three currently placed youth stated that they were not aware of,
nor were they concerned about any organized fighting or sexual
assault within the program.
3

Documentation reviewed:
During an unannounced, face-to-face visit on 10/10/2023 to the
facility to initiate the investigation, the following was reviewed:
• Youth A’s case file was reviewed. He was placed at the
facility from 06/15/2021-03/9/2022. There were multiple
incident reports involving physical altercations between
Youth A and other youth but none that matched the
description from the allegations. No other pertinent
information was gathered.
• Staff 1’s employee file was reviewed. Staff 1 was
terminated from employment on 10/05/2021 due to a
substantiated abuse and neglect case. Allegations from
this past case were unrelated to this investigation.
• Policy was provided by the facility that described corporal
punishment as an unacceptable practice when staff are
providing discipline to youth in the program.
DHHS Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
reviewed there was no evidence found that staff improperly
supervised youth to the effect of youth were fighting or were
sexually assaulted under their watch.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
